snippet: The president’s sinking ratings, a loss in a House election in Florida and millions of dollars spent by Republican-aligned groups attacking the new health law are complicating matters.
abstract: Democrats are becoming increasingly alarmed about their midterm election fortunes amid Pres Obama's sinking approval ratings; adding to their alarm is the loss of a special House election in Florida and millions of dollars spent by Republican-aligned groups attacking the new health law; interviews with Democrats reveal a new urgency over addressing the party's prospects.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: The president’s sinking ratings, a loss in a House election in Florida and millions of dollars spent by Republican-aligned groups attacking the new health law are complicating matters.

headline.main: Obama Factor Adds to Fears of Democrats
headline.print_headline: Obama Factor Adds to Fears of Democrats

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
